answers.answer: Hello and hope you are doing well.Looks like you are under a lot of stress. Dizziness, decreased appetite, random pains and throat constriction could all be due to anxiety. Metabolic disorders like diabetes or hypothyroidism can cause these symptoms. Sometimes a sleep disorder obstructive sleep apnea can produce lack of sleep, dryness of mouth and early morning headaches. In addition she seems to have lost weight.. If other conditions can be ruled out, then her symptoms can be attributed to anxiety.Hope this helped and do keep us posted.

question: This is a question about my wife of 10 years.  She is 34 and never been sick or never complains.  We have 2 kids 2 and 4 and now all the sudden for the past month or so she says she feels like her throat is closing all the time.  Her voice is always real scratchy sounding and she is tired all the time.  She is not acting like herself at all.  Also she says it is so bad she can't live like this and she is dizzy also.  She has lost weight and lost her apatite.  She has seen a Ear Nose and Throat doctor and he has given her allergy test and a thyroid ultrasound and we should know the results next week.I have told her I think its anxiety and she is having panic attacks but she will not listen and just gets upset when we talk about it.  We are best friends and so in love and no home or relationship issues at all but every day for the past few weeks this is all she talks about and she is driving herself and me crazy with it.  She is never happy and always tired and never feels good.  She complains about something bothering her everyday.If anyone has any advice or if this should be posted in another location please let me know.  I would love to be able to tell her what to do or what type of doctor to see.  Sorry for my rambling its so late and I am so upset with not knowing what to do.Thanks again and God Bless
